## GHQ-12 vs RCADS: a comparative study with Harmony

Psychology and social science often necessitates the comparison of data gathered with standard instruments, or questionnaires. Two widely used instruments are the 12-item General Health Questionnaire (GHQ-12) and the Revised Children's Anxiety and Depression Scale (9-item) (RCADS).

The process of matching items from different questionnaires is called "harmonisation". The task is often though of as tedious, subjective and time consuming.


Harmony is an advanced generative AI tool that makes the GHQ-12 vs RCADS comparison, or other harmonisation tasks, far more manageable and reproducible as well as faster.

## Encountering difficulties harmonising GHQ-12 vs RCADS?

* [AUDIT-10 vs ASSIST](/compare-harmonise-instruments/alcoholism/audit-10-vs-assist)


Featuring an easy-to-use web interface, Harmony is designed to streamlines the harmonisation of any psychological metrics. You can select from a range of instruments from Harmony's database, or quite simply drag and drop your own instruments in PDF form. Harmony's AI engine will then utilise its natural language processing abilities to compare these instruments, providing a percentage match between each item such as those found in GHQ-12 and RCADS.


{{< card heading="Try Harmony" copy="Compare GHQ-12 and RCADS " url="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app" >}}

{{< youtube cEZppTBj1NI >}}


Thus, the once tedious process of comparing GHQ-12 vs RCADS becomes a breeze with Harmony. Moreover, Harmony's capabilities reach far beyond straightforward English language metrics. Are you needing to compare GHQ-12 vs RCADS across different languages? No problem. Harmony's generative AI models are well-equipped to handle comparisons in multiple languages. Researchers seeking to test the consistency of longitudinal analysis across a number of studies, or detect responses to changing social conditions, will surely find Harmony to be a valuable addition to their toolset. So why wait? Visit https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app today, and experience harmonisation like never before.
